thread.title: Ryanair: Escape The Rugby World Cup - Fly Cardiff To Dublin From Just £19.99Travelandtourworld.com
thread.title_full: Ryanair: Escape The Rugby World Cup - Fly Cardiff To Dublin From Just £19.99Travelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Ryanair: Escape The Rugby World Cup - Fly Cardiff To Dublin From Just £19.99Travelandtourworld.com
text:
Ryanair: Escape The Rugby World Cup – Fly Cardiff To Dublin From Just £19.99 Published on : Tuesday, August 18, 2015
Ryanair, today offered Welsh customers the chance to escape the Rugby World Cup by booking a bargain flight to Dublin this September and October. Ryanair has scheduled over 25 return Dublin-Cardiff flights for the Rugby World Cup, meaning customers can book a break to the Irish capital from just £19.99 one-way.
Welsh customers can book their flights on an improved website and app with mobile boarding passes, carry a free small 2nd carry-on bag, enjoy allocated seats, avail of Family Extra and Business Plus services, and use their personal electronic devices at all stages of their flight, as Ryanair continues to deliver so much more than just the lowest fares – with much more to come. These bargain Dublin flights are available to book until Thursday, 20th August for travel in September and October.
Ryanair’s Robin Kiely said:
“Ryanair will carry thousands of rugby fans to Wales for the World Cup – and now Welsh customers can escape the rugby fever and bag a bargain trip to Dublin this autumn. We’ve scheduled over 25 extra return flights between Cardiff and Dublin – on 18th, 19th and 20th September, and 10th, 11th, 12th, 16th, 17th 18th and 19th October – so there’s never been a better time to book that trip to Dublin. Seats will be snapped up quickly so customers should log on to the Ryanair.com website and book their flight today.”
